result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth E. Bailey II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Kenneth E. Bailey II appeared in court with his attorney Kyle Reimann.  Larry Nelson appeared for the State.  Defendant sworn.  Ex 1 - PLQ - colloquey given and knowing waiver accepted.  Guilty no contest plea entered on both counts.  Joint recommendation:  Count 1 $265.60 fines and costs plus $200.00 DAN cost, Count 2 $265.60 fines and costs.
Attorney Kyle Robert Reimann in court.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.

No contact with A.B. or that person's residence lifted on 09/25/2015; no violent, abusive, or profane conduct;  defendant shall be prohibited from possessing or ingesting any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Kenneth E. Bailey not in court.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amanda Bailey is present in court.  She is requesting to modify the bond to allow contact between her and the defendant.  Familey advocates have been in contact with Amanda.  Bond to be modified to no violent, abusive, or profane conduct.  Ms. Bailey will have a 3rd party contact the defendant and inform him he will need to report to sign new bond.

Defendant Kenneth E. Bailey in court with attorney Kyle Robert Reimann.  Defendant Kenneth E. Bailey in custody.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No objection to video appearance.  Waive reading of complaint.  NG plea entered.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Bond conditions reviewed:  Atty Reimann wants no contact lifted.  Atty Nelson wishes to speak to DOC before lifting any conditions.  If a victim would like an amendment, they need to contact the Court.
